title: Therapy llamas help calm travelers at Portland International Airport | Video | kdrv.com
text: Therapy llamas help calm travelers at Portland International Airport Weather Alert ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 7 PM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Southeast winds 15 to 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. * WHERE...In California, portions of Central Siskiyou County and South Central Siskiyou County. This includes the Shasta Valley and Interstate 5 from Weed to Grenada. In Oregon, portions of Jackson County. This includes the southern Rogue Valley and Interstate 5 between Ashland and Medford, and the foothills of the Cascades. * WHEN...From 7 PM this evening to 7 PM PST Friday. Winds will be strongest on Friday from mid-morning through the afternoon. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. && Currently in Medford 53°F Mostly Cloudy 53°F / 41°F 3 PM 53°F 4 PM 53°F 5 PM 52°F 6 PM 51°F 7 PM 50°F © Copyright 2023 [Allen Media Broadcasting](https://allenmediabroadcasting.com/), P.O.
